lines.text: No Mama, I don't hate the world.
I've got to go to school. I'm late already. I've got a science test second period.

Pshh. Science, huh? Well, you tell Mr. Goodman there's a lot of work to be done around here, so he'd better not count on you spending your days with half-life. Tell him if he wants to find out about half-life, he can come and ask me; I'm the original half-life. I've got one daughter with half a mind, the other who's half a test tube, a house half-full of rabbit crap and half a corpse. That's a half-life, all right. Jesus, don't you hate the world, Matilda?
I'm not exactly happy about you standing around, discussing testicles with this Chris Burns person, either!
Matilda, would you go get your sister over there, please, before she gets pregnant?

[as Nanny Annie slurps her honey/water]
If anybody had ever told me when I was younger I'd end up feeding honey to a zombie I'd have told them they were crazy. I'd be better off driving a cab.
